bibl.title: Despatch from M. A. Aenmey to William Hunter
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: Second Assistant U.S. Secretary of State

div1.p:
United States Consulate General
Monrovia. March 28, 1882
M A Aenmey to the Second Assistant Secy of State
Mrs M. Barboza appointed as Sole Administratrix of the estate of the late Henry Highland Garnet.

United States Consulate General
Monrovia March 28, 1882.

Honbl
Second Assistant Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor to inform you that, Mrs. M. Barboza has been appointed by the Probate Court of Montsurado County Republic Liberia, during the March Session, as Sole Administratrix for the Estate of the late Henry H. Garnet.
Mrs M. Barboza is the only daughter and legal heir in this country, of the late H. H. Garnet, and as such has taken charge of the personal property and effects left by the deceased

With sentiment of the highest esteem
I am Sir your obedient servant
M. A. Aenmey
U.S. Vice Consul Genl
